projectPurpose: To implement the Stacks blockchain, a Layer-1 (often described as Layer-2 on Bitcoin) blockchain designed to bring smart contract functionality and decentralized applications (dApps) to the Bitcoin ecosystem without modifying the core Bitcoin protocol, leveraging Bitcoin's security and network effects.
mainFeatures: Bitcoin-anchored Layer-1 blockchain for smart contracts and dApps
Proof of Transfer (PoX) consensus mechanism linked to Bitcoin mining
Clarity smart contract language for predictable and secure execution
Enables 'stacking' STX to earn Bitcoin rewards
Smart contracts can read Bitcoin state and react to Bitcoin transactions
Transactions settle on the Bitcoin blockchain for enhanced security
Supports faster transactions and microblocks compared to Bitcoin's base layer
Decentralized peg system (sBTC) for trust-minimized BTC movement (upcoming)

alternatives.name: Ethereum
mainFeatures: Wide range of dApps and DeFi protocols

alternatives.name: Solana
mainFeatures: Proof of History (PoH) and Proof of Stake (PoS) consensus

Designed for dApps and enterprise solutions

alternatives.name: Core Chain

marketPositioning: Stacks is positioned as the leading platform for building smart contracts and decentralized applications that leverage the security and capital of Bitcoin. Unlike other major smart contract platforms that operate with their own independent security models (like Ethereum, Solana, Cardano, and Avalanche), Stacks is uniquely anchored to Bitcoin through its Proof of Transfer consensus mechanism. This allows it to inherit Bitcoin's unparalleled security guarantees and unlock Bitcoin's potential for programmatic use cases without altering Bitcoin's core protocol. Its market position is defined by being the primary gateway for developers and users to bring Web3 functionality, such as DeFi and NFTs, directly onto the most secure and decentralized blockchain network, Bitcoin.
